poem:
Explosive Silence

In the crackling static
of pagers, walkie-talkies—
red shards of morning.

Careful hands threaded fate,
small seeds of steel
in plastic shells—

the unseen detonates
in the winding shadow,
voices severed mid-breath.

A city's pulse,
quieted and sharp,
ripples through the radio.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. But, even without Israel publicly admitting responsibility, it is clear that the attack must have been carefully planned – however uncertain its consequences. Experts generally believe a small mount of stable explosive was carefully implanted into each sabotaged". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
